trans-unit.source: The exception that is thrown when authentication fails for an authentication stream.
The <xref:System.Net.Security.NegotiateStream> and <xref:System.Net.Security.SslStream> classes throw this exception when the client or server cannot be authenticated.
When this exception is thrown, you can retry the authentication with different credentials.
If you cannot retry the authentication, a <xref:System.Security.Authentication.InvalidCredentialException> is thrown instead of the AuthenticationException.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.AuthenticationException"></xref> class with no message.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.AuthenticationException"></xref> class with the specified message.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property with the text in the `message` parameter.
A <xref:System.String> that describes the authentication failure.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.AuthenticationException"></xref> class from the specified instances of the <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> and <xref:System.Runtime.Serialization.StreamingContext> classes.

A <xref href="System.Runtime.Serialization.SerializationInfo"></xref> instance that contains the information required to deserialize the new <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.AuthenticationException"></xref> instance.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Security.Authentication.AuthenticationException"></xref> class with the specified message and inner exception.

This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Exception.Message%2A> property with the text in the `message` parameter and initializes the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property with the `innerException` parameter value.
A <xref:System.String> that describes the authentication failure.
The <xref:System.Exception> that is the cause of the current exception.
